required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lu AF28996 in Patients With Parkinson's Disease (PD)
clinical_study.official_title: Interventional, Open-label, Exploratory Study, Investigating the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Efficacy of Lu AF28996 in Patients With Parkinson's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the safety of Lu AF28996, how well it is tolerated and what the body does to the drug in Patients With Parkinson's Disease

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-emergent adverse events
primary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability based on the safety assessments (clinical safety laboratory tests, vital signs, weight, ECG parameters and physical examination)

primary_outcome.time_frame: from zero to last quantifiable plasma concentration on day 33 (or the actual final dosing day)
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time curve from zero to last quantifiable plasma concentration

primary_outcome.time_frame: from zero to 24 hours post-dose on Day 1, 13, 25, 29 and 33
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time curve from zero to 24 hours post dose

primary_outcome.time_frame: from zero to 24 hours post-dose on Day 1, 13, 25, 29 and 33
primary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration of Lu AF28996

primary_outcome.time_frame: from zero to 24 hours on day 33 (or the actual final dosing day)
primary_outcome.description: Oral clearance for Lu AF28996 in plasma

arm_group.description: Titration of Lu AF28996 as add-on to levodopa - planned to be up to 26 days
Stable dose of Lu AF28996 as add-on to levodopa - planned to be 2 days
Flexible doses of Lu AF28996 as monotherapy (without levodopa) - up to 5 days

intervention.description: capsule, orally, doses and dose escalation scheme will be decided upon at dosing conferences

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men or women diagnosed with idiopathic PD (consistent with the UK PD Society Brain Bank Criteria for the Diagnosis of PD), Modified Hoehn and Yahr Staging ≤4 in 'OFF' and ≤3 in 'ON' state and a Mini Mental State Examination Score >26.
- Patients must currently have a good response to levodopa, and be receiving a stable dose of levodopa (>3 doses per day of standard levodopa or >3 doses per day of carbidopa and levodopa, or benserazide and levodopa, Extended-Release Capsules) for at least 4 weeks prior to screening. If the patient's response to Levodopa has not been previously documented in medical records, the patient will be submitted to a Levodopa challenge test while in practically defined OFF state prior to enrolment.
- Patients must experience recognizable and predictable motor fluctuations (with at least 1.5 hours of OFF-periods in the awake time, including predictable morning OFF episodes) causing clinically significant disability during the 4-week screening period. This will be documented during a defined period of 3 consecutive days prior to enrolment, using a patient diary.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The patient has or has had one or more of the following conditions that are considered clinically relevant in the context of the study; other neurological disorder, psychiatric disorder, seizure disorder or encephalopathy, respiratory disease, hepatic impairment or renal insufficiency, metabolic disorder, endocrinological disorder, haematological disorder, infectious disorder, any clinically significant immunological condition, elevated intra-ocular pressure or is at risk of acute narrow-angle glaucoma
Other in- and exclusion criteria may apply
